snippet: This week, New York City’s busiest train line is shutting down four nights for repairs, closing off a central artery between Midtown Manhattan and Downtown Brooklyn.
abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority is shutting down New York City's busiest stretch of subway, the Lexington Avenue line, for four nights of overnight repairs in an attempt to make up for years of backlogged repairs and deferred maintenance; shutdown, a seismic shift for New Yorkers used to 24-hour service, underscores the frailty of the aging system.

byline.contributor: Christopher Maag and Alex Vadukul contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: This week, New York City’s busiest train line is shutting down four nights for repairs, closing off a central artery between Midtown Manhattan and Downtown Brooklyn.

headline.seo: New York City Subway Closes for Overnight Repairs
headline.main: A Seismic Shift for the Subway: Closing Lines for Night Repairs
headline.print_headline: For the Subway That Never Rests, A Seismic Shift In Night Closings
